author: Special Correspondent
text:
Some of the budget measures that lay emphasis on the road sector are likely to be beneficial to the commercial vehicle industry, which is recording a strong growth after being in slump for a longer-than-expected period.

The infrastructure sector saw a whopping allocation of Rs. 2,18,000 crore, including Rs. 97,000 crore to expedite expansion of highways and rural roads. These measures are expected to spur demand for commercial vehicles.

While demand for trucks is expected to increase, there is also positive news for the passenger segment, with Finance Minister Arun Jaitley proposing to improve the public transport system.

He signalled the government’s intent to abolish permit raj over the medium term. This is a much-awaited step. He pointed out that the government would amend the Motor Vehicles Act and open up the road transport sector in the passenger segment.
title: Boost for commercial vehicles
